description: An Israeli airstrike on Iran's consulate in Damascus killed two Iranian generals and five others, Iranian state media said Monday. Israel has not yet commented on the attack.
title: Iranian officials accuse Israel of a deadly attack on Iran's consulate in Syria

description: It's one of the few days of the year where the executive branch becomes a child's playground — and this year, the White House Easter Egg Roll drew kids to the South Lawn despite some light rain.
title: White House hosts a soggy, education-themed Easter egg roll

description:
Sderot, Israel, near the border with Gaza, was the biggest city attack by Hamas on October 7th. At the beginning of the war, Israel evacuated nearly everyone. Our correspondent visits Sderot and finds that people are returning.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Israelis Return to a City that was Attacked

description: Stock in the parent company of former president Donald Trump's social media platform sank on Monday, after the company reported losing $58 million last year.  That erased last week's market gains.
title: Trump's social media stock tumbles, erasing early gains

description: United Airlines says it's trying to reduce pilot staffing levels next month because it's not receiving as many new 737 Max planes as expected, the latest fallout from manufacturing problems at Boeing.
title: United asks pilots to take unpaid leave in May because of delivery delays at Boeing

description: Oregon schools are struggling more than others across the country to recover academic learning losses. Experts say one likely reason is a lack of statewide consistency in tutoring interventions.
title: Why Oregon schools' pandemic recovery lags behind much of the nation

description: Prompted by a recent photo of three U.S. presidents in suits without neckwear, fashion historian Kimberly Chrisman-Campbell details about how popular ties are — or aren't.
title: Three presidents and not a necktie in sight. Are ties out of fashion?

description: White House officials appear to be trying to hold an event that will both reflect the somber mood in the Muslim community because of the war and also curb the possibility of protests.
title: The White House is planning a scaled-down iftar dinner to mark Ramadan this year

description: When Roxanne Olson found herself in the middle of a security scare at Chicago's O'Hare airport, a woman walked up to her and said: "I'm here to help people like you."
title: 'I was broken and needed help': After her father died, a stranger stepped in

description: Israeli forces have withdrawn from a Gaza hospital after a two-week assault, AT&T says a data breach has compromised the personal data of current and former users.
title: Israel withdraws from a Gaza hospital, AT&T data breach affects millions of users

description: Bird flu has been detected in cattle in several states. Its believed to be the first time the disease has infected dairy cows.
title: Dairy cows test positive for bird flu, but officials say risk to public is low

description: A Brief History of the Future, on PBS, is an example of a "protopian" show from a new production studio helmed by Kathryn Murdoch. She believes we need more hopeful stories abut the future.
title: Dystopias are so 2020. Meet the new protopias that show a hopeful future

description: It's always smart to keep your guard up online, especially on April Fools' Day. Experts in misinformation and news literacy offer steps you can take to avoid getting fooled, and not just on Monday.
title: 5 tips for not getting tricked online this April Fools' Day — and beyond

description: Rogue insurance agents access consumer information on the Affordable Care Act federal marketplace and make the changes. Policyholders can lose their doctors and end up owing back taxes.
title: ACA health insurance plans are being switched without enrollees' OK

description: A US Forest Service burn boss was due before a Grant County, Oregon court Monday on charges stemming from a controlled burn that spread onto private land in the Fall of 2022.
title: Conservative Oregon county attempts criminal prosecution of federal employee

description: Due to fears of "cancellation," alternative technology and financial platforms are being built for the so-called freedom economy by figures on the far right, including those with antisemitic beliefs.
title: How anti-vaccine activists and the far right are trying to build a parallel economy

description: It bills itself as a "world-class African city" but these days residents say it's anything but — with the collapse of the water system and frequent power outages.
title: Johannesburg's water crisis is the latest blow to South Africa's 'world-class city'

description: The Biden campaign is running ads in states expected to be competitive this election, targeting Black and Latino voters in particular.
title: Biden is using his cash advantage to address vulnerabilities against Trump

description: It's a big win for cooks, cashiers and other fast-food employees, among the least paid in the workforce. Restaurant owners and franchisees warn of higher prices and cuts to workers' hours.
title: Half a million California workers will get $20 minimum wage, starting today

description: The Windy City has the most lead pipes of any U.S. city. A study estimates that more than two-thirds of children there are exposed to lead in their home tap water.
title: Lead in the drinking water is still a problem in the U.S. — especially in Chicago

description: Tens of thousands of Israelis thronged central Jerusalem on Sunday in the largest anti-government protest since the country went to war in October.
title: Israelis stage largest protest since war began to increase pressure on Netanyahu

description: Turkey's main opposition party retained its control over key cities and made huge gains elsewhere in Sunday's local elections, in a major upset to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: In a setback to Turkey's Erdogan, opposition makes huge gains in local election

description: According to documents published by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, the intermediate shaft and right front driveshaft of certain 2020-2024 Tellurides may not be fully engaged.
title: Kia recalls over 427,000 Telluride SUVs because they might roll away while parked
